greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 4*A060819(n-2)*A060819(n+2).
comment: A060819 is sign extended to negative n by A060819(0)=0 and A060819(-n) = -A060819(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = -2..5000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,3,0,0,0,-3,0,0,0,1).
formula: a(n) = 3*a(n-4) - 3*a(n-8) + a(n-12). This implies that A033996, A158443 and two other 2nd-order polynomials are quadrisections. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 01 2011
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Nov 13 2010
